text: ude the following:         -  Combination chemotherapy.    -  Radiation therapy to bone tumors, as palliative therapy to relieve symptoms and improve the quality of life.    -  Radiation therapy that may be followed by surgery to remove tumors that have spread to the lungs.     -  High-dose chemotherapy with stem cell rescue.    -  Targeted therapy with a monoclonal antibody.        These treatments and the order they are given depend on the following:         - Where in the body the tumor came
